definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
frame (e.g. door frame)/casing/fig. framework/template/to circle (i.e. draw a circle around sth)/to frame/to restrict/Taiwan pr. [kuang1]

sentences.english: On the wall of your former dorm room, unframed.
sentences.chinese: 在你以前集體宿舍的牆上，沒有畫框。

sentences.english: House was shaking. Pic fell off bookcase.
sentences.chinese: 房子在搖晃，書架上的畫框掉落下來。

sentences.english: A tree of blue apricot flowers filled the frame, with a feather of the bird on one of the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 畫框被藍色的杏花樹填滿，一隻鳥的羽毛落在樹葉上。

sentences.english: 'Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame. ' G. K.
sentences.chinese: 藝術存在於限制，那麼每一幅畫最美的地方就是畫框。

sentences.english: Her husband mounts the work on velour paper and makes the frame.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫把作品裝裱在絨紙上，並製作了畫框。

sentences.english: The dark-coloured frame shows off the painting well.
sentences.chinese: 深色的畫框把畫襯托得很好看。

sentences.english: The painter stretched the canvas on a frame.
sentences.chinese: 畫家把油畫布緊繃在畫框上。

sentences.english: The picture is made of chocolate. The frame is edible.
sentences.chinese: 這幅畫是用巧克力做成的，畫框也可以食用。

sentences.english: Those decals, I always hate that when you buy a picture frame and the sticker's on it.
sentences.chinese: 這些貼紙，我討厭在買到畫框時上面有不乾膠貼紙。

sentences.english: The frames up on the walls shook.
They frame the content of your pages.
sentences.chinese: 它們象一個畫框一樣包圍着你的頁面內容。

sentences.english: I love the original frame, too; I’ve never wanted to change it, as I like the fact she chose it all those years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜歡她當年選擇的畫框，從來沒有想過要更換它。

definition: to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
